Detailed Description

Optimizer for SVM training by quadratic programming.

Author:
T. Glasmachers
Date:
2006
Although the SVM_Optimizer fits into the ReClaM concept of an Optimizer, it should not be used the usual way, for three reasons:
  • It does not depend on the error function object provided as a parameter to optimize.
  • It does not return an error value. The return is zero in any case.
  • It is not an iterative optimizer. The first call to optimize already finds the optimal solution.
Nevertheless, the SVM_Optimizer is one of the most important classes in the SVM context, as it calls the C_Solver class to solve the SVM dual problem, computing the SVM coefficients and b.

Member Function Documentation

C_Solver* SVM_Optimizer::get_Solver (  )  [inline]

Return the C_Solver used by the previous call to optimize.

The C_Solver object may be of use for the calling procedure as it proviedes some solution statistics as the number of iterations used for training and the final objective function value.

Definition at line 426 of file svm.h.

References solver.

void SVM_Optimizer::init ( C_SVM &  model,
bool  verbose,
unsigned int  mb = 100 
)

Initialization of the SVM training optimizer.

This initialization method is specifically designed for the needs of SVM training. It should be used instead of the default initialization method whenever possible.
Parameters:
model The model parameter is passed to the default init method.
verbose If true, the optimizer outputs status information to the standard output.
mb Megabytes of main memory used as a cache for the kernel matrix.

Definition at line 406 of file svm.cpp.

References cacheMB, init(), and printInfo.

void SVM_Optimizer::init ( Model &  model  )  [virtual]

Default initialization.

This is the default Model initialization method. If the model parameter is not a valid C_SVM meta model, the method will throw an exception. This method is only provided for compatibility with the Model interface. If possible the specialized init method should be used.
Parameters:
model Meta model containing complexity constant and kernel

Implements Optimizer.

void SVM_Optimizer::optimize ( SVM &  model,
const Array< double > &  input,
const Array< double > &  target 
)

Trains the SVM with the given dataset.

This version of the optimize member is well suited for SVM training, but it does not fit into the ReClaM concept. Thus, a less specialized version of optimize is available, which overrides the corresponding Optimizer member.
Parameters:
model The SVM model to optimize
input Training input used for the optimization
target Training labels used for the optimization

Definition at line 430 of file svm.cpp.

References alpha, cacheMB, Cminus, Cplus, SVM::get_examples(), SVM::getKernel(), Model::getParameter(), norm2penalty, printInfo, Model::setParameter(), SVM::setTrainingData(), and solver.

double SVM_Optimizer::optimize ( Model &  model,
ErrorFunction &  error,
const Array< double > &  input,
const Array< double > &  target 
) [virtual]

Default Optimizer interface.

The optimize member uses the C_Solver class to train the Support Vector Machine. If the model parameter supplied is not a valid SVM object, the method checks for a C_SVM object to determine the unserlying SVM. Otherwise it throws an exception.
Note that no ErrorFunction object is needed for SVM training. If no ErrorFunction object is available, the static dummy reference dummyError can be used.
Parameters:
model The SVM model to optimize
error The error object is not used at all. The dummyError can be used.
input Training input used for the optimization
target Training labels used for the optimization
Returns:
As there is no error evaluation, the function returns 0 in any case.

Implements Optimizer.

ErrorFunction & SVM_Optimizer::dummyError = *((ErrorFunction*)NULL) [static]

The static member dummyError is provided for calls to the optimize method in case there is no ErrorFunction object available.

Do not use or call any members of dummyError, as it is an invalid reference. It is only provided for making syntactically correct calls to the optimize method.
